elements.title: Laura Bergt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Laura Bergt was said to have gained millions of acres of land for Native Alaskans by Eskimo-kissing Vice President Spiro Agnew (pictured)?

elements.title: Eighth Avenue South Reservoir (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Nashville's Eighth Avenue South Reservoir ruptured in 1912, one family was swept away while still lying in bed?

elements.title: Leonard Parrington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Brigadier Leonard Parrington ordered him to surrender Sergeant Jack Hinton told him to "go and jump in the bloody lake"?

elements.title: Shrine of Husayn's Head (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the demolition of the Shrine of Husayn's Head, probably the most important Shi'a Muslim shrine in Israel, may have been related to efforts to transfer Palestinians out of the country?

elements.title: Elena Manistina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as a last-minute substitute in a premiere performance at Oper Frankfurt, Elena Manistina sang from the side while the assistant director mimed onstage?

elements.title: 14th Place station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the agent at 14th Place station was the target of an attempted murder?

elements.title: Soekiman Wirjosandjojo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although he was a former Indonesian prime minister, Soekiman Wirjosandjojo was not arrested during a political purge as he was considered a non-threat?

elements.title: Tarn Wadling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the now-drained lake Tarn Wadling was famous as a liminal place where the spectre of Guinevere's dead mother appeared to her and Gawain in The Awntyrs off Arthure?
